headline: Microchip, Under Armour rise in premarket; Adidas falls
summary: Investing.com-- S&P 500 Index futures were little changed at 7:23 AM in New York, as the early New Year rally showed signs of pausing with investors waiting for fresh data to assess the strength of the U.S. economy. headline: Microchip shares rise after preannouncement as recovery gains momentum
summary: Investing.com -- Microchip Technology shares have risen more than 4% premarket on Tuesday after the company said late Monday that quarterly revenue would come in well above prior guidance, signalling strengthening demand and progress on its recovery plan.

content.title: Microchip shares rise after preannouncement as recovery gains momentum

headline: Microchip Technology (MCHP): Buy, Sell, or Hold Post Q3 Earnings?
summary: Since July 2025, Microchip Technology has been in a holding pattern, posting a small loss of 2.9% while floating around $69.41. The stock also fell short of the S&P 500‚Äôs 10.1% gain during that period.

headline: AIG CEO to step down in June, Ford posts strong Q4 sales
summary: Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman and Yahoo Finance markets and data editor Jared Blikre track several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including American International Group (AIG) CEO Peter Zaffino announcing his plans to step down this June, Microchip Technology's (MCHP) preliminary earnings results pointing to a recovery in sales, and Ford (F) reporting strong fourth quarter sales figures. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more¬†Market Catalysts.

headline: Microchip Technology, NXP Semiconductors, Texas Instruments, Western Digital, and Allegro MicroSystems Stocks Trade Up, What You Need To Know
summary: A number of stocks jumped in the afternoon session after a broader market rally drove investor optimism in artificial intelligence and big tech stocks. The S&P 500, Dow Jones, and Nasdaq all pushed higher, approaching record levels set late last year. Much of the positive momentum was linked to the technology sector, with a particular focus on companies advancing artificial intelligence, a key theme at the annual CES trade show in Las Vegas.
